intro: Oxyanthus speciosus subsp. mollis, commonly known as the silky oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist areas of the forest understory. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
